Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

15  KSIntDecay::KSIntDecay() :
16  fSplit( false ),
17  fCalculator( NULL ),
18  fCalculators(),
19  fLifeTimes(),
20  fEnhancement( 1. )

49  vector<double> KSIntDecay::CalculateLifetimes(const KSParticle &aTrajectoryInitialParticle)
50  {
51  double tInitialLifeTime;
52  vector<double> tLifetimes (fCalculators.size(), std::numeric_limits<double>::max());
53 
54  for( unsigned int tIndex = 0; tIndex < fCalculators.size(); tIndex++ )
55  {
56  fCalculators.at( tIndex )->CalculateLifeTime( aTrajectoryInitialParticle, tInitialLifeTime);
57  intmsg(eDebug) << fCalculators.at(tIndex)->GetName() << " initial life time " << tInitialLifeTime << eom;
58 
59  tLifetimes.at(tIndex) = tInitialLifeTime;
60  }
61  return tLifetimes;
62  }
63 
64 
65  void KSIntDecay::CalculateInteraction(
66  const KSTrajectory& aTrajectory,
67  const KSParticle& aTrajectoryInitialParticle,
68  const KSParticle& aTrajectoryFinalParticle,
69  const KThreeVector& /*aTrajectoryCenter*/,
70  const double& /*aTrajectoryRadius*/,
71  const double& aTrajectoryTimeStep,
72  KSParticle& anInteractionParticle,
73  double& aTimeStep,
74  bool& aFlag
75  )
76  {
77  intmsg_debug( "decay interaction <" << this->GetName() << "> calculating interaction:" << eom );
78 
79  vector<double> tLifetimes = CalculateLifetimes(aTrajectoryInitialParticle);
80  vector<double> tTimes (fCalculators.size(), numeric_limits<double>::max() );
81  for(unsigned int tIndex =0; tIndex <fCalculators.size(); tIndex++ )
82  {
83  tTimes.at(tIndex) = -1. * log( KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform( 0., 1. ) ) * tLifetimes.at(tIndex) / fEnhancement;
84  intmsg_debug(" decay time " << fCalculators.at(tIndex)->GetName() << ": " << tTimes.at(tIndex) << eom);
85  }
86 
87  unsigned long tSmallest = (unsigned long) (std::min_element(tTimes.begin(),tTimes.end()) - tTimes.begin());
88  intmsg_debug( " samllest decay time: <" << tTimes.at(tSmallest) << ">" << eom );
89  intmsg_debug( " aTrajectoryTimeStep: <" << aTrajectoryTimeStep << ">" << eom );
90 
91  if( tTimes.at(tSmallest) > aTrajectoryTimeStep )
92  {
93  fCalculator = NULL;
94 
95  anInteractionParticle = aTrajectoryFinalParticle;
96  aTimeStep = aTrajectoryTimeStep;
97  aFlag = false;
98 
99  intmsg_debug( " no decay process occurred" << eom );
100  }
101  else
102  {
103  fCalculator = fCalculators.at(tSmallest);
104 
105  anInteractionParticle = aTrajectoryInitialParticle;
106  aTrajectory.ExecuteTrajectory( tTimes.at(tSmallest), anInteractionParticle );
107  aTimeStep = tTimes.at(tSmallest);
108  aFlag = true;
109 
110  intmsg_debug( " decay process <" << fCalculator->GetName() << "> may occur" << eom );
111  }
112 
113  return;
114  }
115 
116  void KSIntDecay::ExecuteInteraction( const KSParticle& anInteractionParticle,
117  KSParticle& aFinalParticle,
118  KSParticleQueue& aSecondaries ) const
119  {
120  if( fCalculator != NULL )
121  {
122  if(fSplit)
123  {
124  KSParticle* tSplitParticle = new KSParticle();
125  *tSplitParticle = aFinalParticle;
126 
127  fCalculator->ExecuteInteraction( anInteractionParticle, *tSplitParticle, aSecondaries );
128  aSecondaries.push_back( tSplitParticle );
129 
130  aFinalParticle.SetActive( false );
131  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
132  }
133  else
134  {
135  fCalculator->ExecuteInteraction( anInteractionParticle, aFinalParticle, aSecondaries );
136  }
137  }
138  else
139  {
140  aFinalParticle = anInteractionParticle;
141  }
142  return;
143  }
144 
145  void KSIntDecay::SetSplit( const bool& aSplit )
146  {
147  fSplit = aSplit;
148  return;
149  }

151  const bool& KSIntDecay::GetSplit() const
152  {
153  return fSplit;
154  }
155 
156  void KSIntDecay::AddCalculator( KSIntDecayCalculator* aScatteringCalculator )
157  {
158  KSIntDecayCalculator* tCalculator;
159  vector< KSIntDecayCalculator* >::iterator tIt;
160  for( tIt = fCalculators.begin(); tIt != fCalculators.end(); tIt++ )
161  {
162  tCalculator = (*tIt);
163  if( tCalculator == aScatteringCalculator )
164  {
165  intmsg( eError ) << "could not add scattering calculator <"
166  << aScatteringCalculator->GetName() << "> to scattering module <"
167  << GetName() << ">" << eom;
168  return;
169  }
170  }
171  fCalculators.push_back( aScatteringCalculator );
172  fLifeTimes.resize( fCalculators.size(), 0. );
173  intmsg_debug( "added scattering calculator <" << aScatteringCalculator->GetName()
174  << "> to scattering module <" << GetName() << ">" << eom );
175  return;
176  }
177 
178  void KSIntDecay::RemoveCalculator( KSIntDecayCalculator* aScatteringCalculator )
179  {
180  KSIntDecayCalculator* tCalculator;
181  vector< KSIntDecayCalculator* >::iterator tIt;
182  for( tIt = fCalculators.begin(); tIt != fCalculators.end(); tIt++ )
183  {
184  tCalculator = (*tIt);
185  if( tCalculator == aScatteringCalculator )
186  {
187  fCalculators.erase( tIt );
188  fLifeTimes.resize( fCalculators.size(), 0. );
189  intmsg_debug( "removed scattering calculator <" << aScatteringCalculator->GetName()
190  << "> to scattering module <" << GetName() << ">" << eom );
191  return;
192  }
193  }
194  intmsg( eError ) << "could not remove scattering calculator <" << aScatteringCalculator->GetName()
195  << "> to scattering module <" << GetName() << ">" << eom;
196  return;
197  }

201  fEnhancement = anEnhancement;

204  void KSIntDecay::InitializeComponent()
205  {
206  KSIntDecayCalculator* tCalculator;
207  vector< KSIntDecayCalculator* >::iterator tIt;
208  for( tIt = fCalculators.begin(); tIt != fCalculators.end(); tIt++ )
209  {
210  tCalculator = (*tIt);
211  if( tCalculator != NULL )
212  {
213  tCalculator->Initialize();
214  }
215  }
216  return;
217  }
